notesStmt.note: The wooden case has minor losses to handle and ends. The outermost membrane has non-sewn joint at centre, silked on recto to contain pigments.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 3 membranes, with wooden roller and wooden case (+ short paper strip for attachment to roller).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script of the 17th century. First seven columns due to a later hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Full borders around columns, inhabited with floral decorations, in watercolours.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Sir Hans Sloane: baronet, physician and collector (b. 1660, d. 1753): in his collection; acquired by the British Museum in 1753.
